intro: Gastrolobium forrestii, commonly known as the Forrester's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Gastrolobium forrestii is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
